docs.text: review : ghost dog : the way of the samurai ( 1999 )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: cast : forest whitaker , henry silva , cliff gorman , john tormey , gene riffini , victor argo , tricia vessey , isaach de bankole' , camille winbush director : jim jarmusch writer : jim jarmusch
docs.label: positive

docs.text: rating : good shot ( stars )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: languid , yet pointed and focused , ghost dog : the way of the samurai sublimely savages our cultural fascination with the mafia and the sleek , ultra-cool , cinematic image of the hitman .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: juxtaposing the samurai's honor code of feudal japan against the tradition bound modus operandi of the american/italian mafia , it ceaselessly chips away with a sculptor's precision at the archaic foundations of both as they lumber , dinosaur-like , to function in the modern era .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: director jarmusch gleefully plays the iconoclast , ripping into mafioso precepts with splashes of acidic wit .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: using a palate of bleached colors , jarmusch lugubriously maintains a tone of desolation that belies the many sparks of laugh out loud humor punctuating the film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he doesn't cater to audience expectations of hyper-colorized , stylized violence and gunplay where no one dies .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the action is presented in flat , brutal codas .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: bullets have permanence .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: death has consequences .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the movie rises beyond standard conventions to become a meditation on the concepts of honor and loyalty .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is an anti-movie , of sorts .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there are few photogenic , empathetic characters for the audience to fall in love with .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this isn't a film that lovingly holds your hand .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there are dark , contemplative moments and the film firmly holds you by the shoulder , just so , asserting itself for all to see .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the fulcrum for the movie's thematic balancing act is ghost dog , a mafia hitman .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a twist on the stereotypical image of the mob enforcer , ghost dog is a hilarious contradiction in terms .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: unlike the sleek , muscular killing machines one is accustomed to , we are given an inner city black man who is overweight and slovenly , replete with chapped , dirty hands and rumpled clothing .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he wears a hooded sweatshirt , which he often pulls over his head , giving him a monk-like appearance .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there are no acrobatic back flips and shiny super guns in his arsenal .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he uses old , worn weapons and simply goes about his tasks in economical , efficient and pleasureless fashion .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ghost dog is a disciple of the old ways of the samurai , distilling the essence of his life through the filter of a book , which he reads daily , hagakure : the way of the samurai .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: life consists of simple pleasures for him : ice cream , warm rooftop naps and good books .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ghost dog lives , as it were , by the basic tenet expressed by his book ; one should start each day considering oneself as dead .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: living atop an abandoned building , surrounded by his flock of pet carrier pigeons , ghost dog exists in a netherworld lacking creature comforts and friends .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he craves nothing more .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as he puts it late in the film , " i've seen all i want to see . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he exists in a spiritual world of the mind , gaining moral sustenance from his readings .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ghost dog wasn't always as he is presented .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in several roshomon-like flashbacks , it's shown how ghost dog was assaulted by racist white males and beaten nearly to death until the timely intervention of a good samaritan , that " samaritan " being a foot soldier in an aging crime family .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ghost dog pledges his life to the service of the man , louie ( tormey ) , as repayment .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: after years of loyal service , ghost dog is sent , by louie , to kill " handsome frank " , a made man within louie's organization who has run away with the crime boss's daughter , louise ( vessey ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ghost dog wordlessly executes his task , witnessed by louise , whom he spares , as she sits watching a betty boop cartoon , clutching a copy of the book , roshomon .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in a bit of synchronicity , louise loans the book to ghost dog .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: upset that frank was taken out by someone not from the family , the mob bosses , in turn , put out a hit on ghost dog in a perverse twist of loyalty to their assassinated comrade .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the rest of movie holds the dated value systems of both the mafia and ghost dog up to the light of a new millennium with many acerbic asides as the two come factions come into conflict .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the theme of old cartoons flares up time and again , each time showing cartoon violence that is in sharp counterpoint to the reality of ghost dog's world .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: each time a character is shown watching a cartoon , it's from the same era , betty boop , felix the cat , etc . , a reflection of days gone by .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: near the end , louise is watching a cartoon that's a departure from the previously shown ones .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's a bit of audacity on jarmusch's part that is nicely effective , despite it's surrealistic nature .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as ghost dog floats through his world , his life is touched by two people .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: one is a sage little girl ( winbush ) who connects with ghost dog through their love of reading .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: she comes to symbolize a melding of the old ways and new sensibilities , just as louise ultimately does .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: by film's end , the fact that jamusch is so effective at illustrating the tenuous bond between the two is a testament to his skill as a writer .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the other person in ghost dog's world is an ice cream ( de bankole' ) vendor who only speaks french , yet intuitively shares a rapport with ghost dog .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the vendor is the literal stranger in a strange land .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: jarmusch , through rapper/composer rza , underscores his film with rap and reggae music , which at first blush seems dichotomous , but its primal rhythms serve to strengthen the fundamental nature of the movie .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ghost dog seems to draw some type of strength from the rap music he listens to as he negotiates the streets in various stolen cars .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ( which , in and of itself , presents another paradox about ghost's dog's sense of honor . )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the head mafioso is played by henry silva with a stone faced resignation .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: of all the cartoonish mobsters , he is the only one who appears self aware of his state in the world .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: gorman plays sonny , a lieutenant who respects the old ways , yet has a quirky affinity for rap music , a love comically shown in several impromptu displays .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ruffini seems the truest reflection of the mafia .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he is a husk of a man , assisted by two hearing aids , who barks out advice without truly hearing what he , or others are saying .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: whitaker carries the film by using what truly great actor's use , his face .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ghost dog is reticent to speak , often going for long periods without doing so .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the fact that whitaker can convey such a wide range of emotion through a gesture or look is a remarkable talent .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: although the film has a deliberate pace , some of the late night drives and walks taken by ghost dog dragged the momentum down .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: truly tragic is how ghost dog misinterprets japanese honor in his final confrontation with the mob .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he reveals himself to be so desperate for spiritual guidance through the hagakure that he fails to truly adapt it to what is real and true in his world .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: carried on the shoulders of a remarkable performance by whitaker , ghost dog rises beyond being a characterization or icon , into a figure that garners sympathy , if not a bit of pity .
docs.label: positive
